article.title: MDS Style Guide for PHP Code

abstract.para: Coding conventions for the PHP code of all MDS components

section.title: Introduction
section.para: This document sets the coding conventions for the PHP code of all MDS components (like the MMC web interface for example).

section.title: Code layout
section.para: Indentation: use 4 spaces per indentation level, no tabs allowed.
Encoding: the source code must always use the UTF-8 encoding.
For long html code, templates and views prefer using "short PHP tags":
Code is more explicit and preserve html code source indentation.

section.title: Code indentation and organisation
section.para: block "for", "function", "switch", "if",etc... always end with opening braces on the same line.
Function with long args (more than one line size)

section.title: Comments
section.para: They always start with a capitalized first word.
There is always a space between the // and the begin of the comment. // and /* are fine. Don't use #.
All functions must have a correct doxygen header.

section.title: Naming conventions
section.para: functionName : mixedCase for all function name
_membersValue : member value of a class begin with a "_"
